text: The Bible’s account of Lazarus describes an actual death experience: He was resurrected by Jesus after being dead for four days. (John 11:38-44) If Lazarus had been enjoying some form of afterlife, it would have been cruel of Jesus to bring him back to life on earth. text: We don't hate God-- there's just no scientific proof that he exists. Give me any, I would be happy to believe there is a man in the sky that could listen to my prayers. The problem isn't hate or jealousy, it's how immoral things in the bible control our society, like hating the LGBT community, where families shun their sons and daughters for being gay. Or (which is sort of outdated in America) when women couldn't get a divorce, or even when women were just properties to their husbands in the "eyes of God". So many more examples exist in the Bible that people worship everyday, but the truth is that many many many centuries ago a bunch of homophobic, racist, etc men came together and wrote these "rules" themselves, which eventually made up the bible and created hope for a population that wanted answers. Psychologically, at that time, there was barely any scientific practice and it just seemed fairly sane to follow your parents' religion growing up as a child when you looked up to them.
